free_text.Learning outcomes: The course contents cover notably the structure of genomes, the mechanisms of DNA replication, of checkpoints function and of DNA repair, as well as the regulation of gene expression, from DNA to the post-translational level. [br/]An emphasis will be placed on discussing experimental approaches that allow the analysis of these processes, thus helping students prepare for the Laboratoire Intégré en Sciences de la Vie I,II practical class. [br/]The weekly lectures will be followed by theoretical exercises.[br/]The acquisition of knowledge by the students will be assessed in two "contrôle continu" sessions.
free_text.Content: [li] DNA, chromosomes, genomes[br/][li] Analyzing genes and genomes[br/][li] DNA replication, repair and recombination[br/][li] Gene expression: from DNA to protein[br/][li] Experimental approaches in molecular and cellular biology[br/]
